Art5.name: Principles relating to processing of personal data
Art5.description: Personal data must be processed lawfully, fairly, transparently, for specified purposes, minimally, accurately, with storage limitation, integrity and confidentiality

Art13.name: Information to be provided where personal data are collected from the data subject
Art13.description: Controller must provide information about processing at time of collection

Art17.name: Right to erasure ('right to be forgotten')
Art17.description: Data subjects have the right to obtain erasure of their personal data

Art20.name: Right to data portability
Art20.description: Data subjects have the right to receive their personal data in a structured, machine-readable format

Art25.name: Data protection by design and by default
Art25.description: Controllers must implement appropriate technical and organisational measures for data protection by design

Art30.name: Records of processing activities
Art30.description: Controller must maintain a record of processing activities under its responsibility

Art32.name: Security of processing
Art32.description: Controller must implement appropriate technical and organisational measures to ensure security appropriate to the risk

Art33.name: Notification of a personal data breach to the supervisory authority
Art33.description: In case of breach, controller must notify supervisory authority within 72 hours

Art35.name: Data protection impact assessment
Art35.description: Where processing is likely to result in high risk, controller must carry out DPIA
